meta.name: Automate systematic literature reviews with Google Drive, GPT-4, Gemini, Qdrant and Airtable

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "DOI": "Extracted DOI string or 'Not Found'",
  "Author": "Extracted Authors",
  "Titel": "Extracted Title",
  "Mechanism": "Iterative Self-Correction / Debate Mechanismen",
  "Abstract": "Summary of content (max 3 sentences)",
  "Decision": "Included",
  "Decision Reasoning": "Detailed summary of strengths/weaknesses based on the checklist scores.",
  "Score": 15,
  "Additional notes": "Optional observations or empty string"
}

parameters.content:
## SLR Paper Review Agent

This workflow automates systematic literature review (SLR) for academic papers. It downloads papers from Google Drive, applies strict inclusion/exclusion criteria using LLM agents, logs decisions to Airtable, and stores included papers in Qdrant vector stores for semantic search.

### How it works
1. Searches and downloads papers from Google Drive
2. Extracts text from PDF files
3. Applies LLM-based review against 4 inclusion criteria (IC) and 4 exclusion criteria (EC)
4. Routes papers based on review decision
5. Logs all decisions to Airtable with reasoning
6. Stores included papers in Qdrant with Gemini embeddings
7. Organizes files into included/excluded folders

### Setup steps
1. Connect Google Drive credentials for paper access
2. Configure Airtable base and table for decision logging
3. Set up Qdrant instances for vector storage (up to 3 collections)
4. Configure LLM credentials (OpenAI GPT-4, Google Gemini)
5. Customize inclusion/exclusion criteria in the Basic LLM Chain node
7. Customize scoring criteria in the second Basic LLM Chain node
6. Adjust file organization folders as needed

## Stage 1: Paper Input & Extraction

Searches Google Drive for papers, downloads PDFs, and extracts text content for review.

## Stage 2: LLM-Based SLR Review

Applies strict inclusion/exclusion criteria using LLM agents. Evaluates papers against IC (4 criteria) and EC (4 criteria) with PRISMA documentation.

## Stage 3: Decision Routing & Logging

Routes papers based on review decision (Included/Excluded). Logs all decisions to Airtable with DOI, authors, title, reasoning, and score.

## Stage 4: Vector Store & File Organization

Stores included papers in Qdrant collections with Gemini embeddings. Organizes all papers into included/excluded folders.

messageValues.message: ### ROLE You are an expert academic reviewer. The provided paper has already passed the strict inclusion criteria. Your task is now to perform a "Full Text Review", classify the mechanism used, and calculate a quality score (0-20 points).  ### MECHANISM CLASSIFICATION Analyze which of the following three categories best describes the core mechanism of the paper. Choose the ONE that fits best:  1. **Self-Referential Prompting**    (Definition: Models autonomously generate new prompts or modify existing inputs based on their own outputs.) 2. **Reflective Evaluation**    (Definition: Models evaluate and critique their own answers, typically through explicit "Reflection Prompts" or external feedback loops.) 3. **Iterative Self-Correction / Debate Mechanismen**    (Definition: Models use dialogue-based structures, e.g., Multi-Agent Debates, to generate competing answers, compare them, and converge on a better result.)  ### SCORING RULES Evaluate the paper against the 10 criteria below. Rate each criterion on a scale of **0 to 2**: - **2 Points:** Vollst√§ndig erf√ºllt / klar dokumentiert. - **1 Point:** Teilweise erf√ºllt / unklar dargestellt. - **0 Points:** Nicht vorhanden / unzureichend.  ### QUALITY CHECKLIST (Criteria)  **Teil A: Methodische Validit√§t (Grundlagen)** 1. **Klarheit des Mechanismus:** Beschreibt das Paper den Self-Improvement-Prozess (z. B. Feedback-Schleife, Rollen im Debate) so detailliert, dass er theoretisch replizierbar ist? 2. **Angemessenheit der Baseline:** Wird die Methode gegen anerkannte Baselines (z. B. Zero-shot, Standard CoT) verglichen, um den tats√§chlichen Mehrwert zu belegen? 3. **G√ºte der Validierung:** Wurde die Methode an mehr als einem Datensatz oder mit verschiedenen Modell-Familien (z. B. GPT-4 und Llama) getestet?  **Teil B: Technische Pr√§zision (KI-Spezifika)** 4. **Modell-Transparenz (Kern-Parameter):** Wird nicht nur das Basis-Modell, sondern auch die spezifische Version (z. B. GPT-4-1106-preview) genannt? 5. **Hyperparameter-Dokumentation:** Werden sekund√§re Parameter wie Temperatur, Top-P oder der Seed angegeben, um die Varianz der Ergebnisse einzuordnen? 6. **Iterations-Protokoll:** Wird die Anzahl der Verbesserungsschritte (N) oder das Abbruchkriterium der Schleife exakt definiert?  **Teil C: Bias-Kontrolle & Ergebnisqualit√§t** 7. **Minderung von Richter-Bias:** Wurden Ma√ünahmen gegen Positional Bias (z. B. durch Swapping Answers) oder Verbosity Bias (z. B. durch strikte Wortlimits) ergriffen? 8. **Metrische Pr√§zision:** Werden pr√§zise und vergleichbare Metriken wie Accuracy, Performance Gap Recovered (PGR) oder Elo-Ratings verwendet? 9. **Statistische Belastbarkeit:** Gibt das Paper Konfidenzintervalle, Standardabweichungen oder Ergebnisse √ºber mehrere Testl√§ufe an? 10. **Praktischer Mehrwert:** Bietet die Studie konkrete ‚ÄûBest Practices‚Äú oder Empfehlungen f√ºr die Entwicklung autonomer, agentischer Systeme?  ### TASK 1. Analyze the full text deeply. 2. Extract the meta-data (DOI, Author, Title). 3. **Classify the paper** into exactly one of the 3 defined Mechanisms. 4. Generate a concise Abstract (max 3 sentences). 5. Score the paper on all 10 criteria (Sum = 0-20). 6. Formulate a "Decision Reasoning": Summarize strengths/weaknesses.  ### OUTPUT FORMAT Return ONLY a valid JSON object matching this schema exactly:  {   "DOI": "Extracted DOI string or 'Not Found'",   "Author": "Extracted Authors",   "Titel": "Extracted Title",   "Mechanism": "Strictly one of: 'Self-Referential Prompting', 'Reflective Evaluation', or 'Iterative Self-Correction / Debate Mechanismen'",   "Abstract": "Summary of content (max 3 sentences)",   "Decision": "Included",   "Decision Reasoning": "Detailed summary of strengths/weaknesses based on the checklist scores.",   "Score": Integer between 0 and 20,   "Additional notes": "Optional observations or empty string" }

qdrantCollection.value: Self-Referential Prompting - ‚Äì Modelle generieren eigenst√§ndig neue Prompts oder modifizieren bestehende Eingaben auf Basis eigener Ausgaben.

qdrantCollection.value: Reflective Evaluation ‚Äì Modelle bewerten und hinterfragen ihre eigenen Antworten, typischerweise durch explizite ‚ÄûReflection Prompts‚Äú oder externe Feedback-Schleifen.
qdrantCollection.cachedResultName: Reflective Evaluation ‚Äì Modelle bewerten und hinterfragen ihre eigenen Antworten, typischerweise durch explizite ‚ÄûReflection Prompts‚Äú oder externe Feedback-Schleifen.

qdrantCollection.value: Iterative Self-Correction Debate Mechanismen ‚Äì Modelle nutzen dialogbasierte Strukturen (z. B. LLM Debates), um konkurrierende Antworten zu erzeugen, zu vergleichen und auf ein besseres Ergebnis zu konvergieren.
